User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11) Gecko/20110211 Firefox/4.0b11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11) Gecko/20110211 Firefox/4.0b11

If you uncheck the "allow pages to choose their own fonts" preference, then load a page that has a <pre style="font-family: courier">, the pre text will be rendered in a variable-width font. (pre text without "font-family..." will be rendered in a fixed font, as it should be.)

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Run firefox4 with a fresh profile.
2.prefs->content->fonts&colors->advanced-> uncheck "allow pages to choose their own fonts"
3.Ensure that the monospace font selected is actually a monospaced font.
4.Load the attached test page
Actual Results:  
The text in the first pre is rendered in a variable width font.

Expected Results:  
The text should have been rendered in a monospaced font -- ideally the one I chose on the prefs page. 

This is remarkably similar to bug 159440, which I submitted in 2002 and was fixed in 2006. Perhaps the fix there may shed light on the current problem. I'm pretty sure the last version of firefox 3.x did not have this problem.

comments.raw_text:
Confirming that I see the same problem here on Windows.

(Note that the testcase is misleading under Windows with D2D, because there's no font named "courier" available, so it fails even when "Allow pages to choose their own fonts" is selected, but in that case the failure is to be expected. Switching to GDI or changing the testcase to specify a font that is available to DirectWrite shows the issue as described.)
